result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

defendant.name: Carley, Brian C.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 19, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

1:23 PM 2021CM000176/22CM52/ 22CF80 - Defendant Brian C. Carley in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Brian C. Carley.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burdick speaks that BC would like to enter a NG plea and a NGI.

22CM52 - Max penalties stated. Attorney Burdick enters a NGI plea.
22CF80 - Max penalties stated. Attorney Burdick enters a NGI plea.

Court appoint Dr. Scott Woodley and deadline for the report is 1/16/23.
Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

2:08 PM 21CM176/ 22CF52/ 22CF80 - Defendant Brian C. Carley in court.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Brian C. Carley.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burdick provides the court with a waiver of the preliminary hearing form for 22CF52 and 22CF80. Court goes over the waiver of the preliminary hearing form. Court binds over for trial. Attorney Burdick asks for a date and time for the arraignment. 

Attorney Burdick states that we are not objecting the competency report.

02:32 PM - Same appearances. Court speaks about the competency report. BC states that he is competent. Court finds the defendant competent to proceed. Attorney Burdick still feel satisfied with the waiver of the preliminary hearing. Court confirms the bind over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Forfeit Bond and Notice of Hearing was sent to CB.
Attachments to Motion to Forfeit Bond
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:25 AM Defendant Brian C. Carley in court.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Brian C. Carley.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal speaks that the state would be dismissing count 1. Attorney Harper comments. Court dismisses count 1 on motion of the state on 22CF52. Attorney McDougal waives the formal reading and waives time limits to the preliminary hearing. Court sets the preliminary hearing in 22CF52; Status will be schedule for the same date in 21CM176.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:40 AM Defendant Brian C. Carley appeared by video.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney McDougal hasn't received the complaint and asks for a set over. Attorney McDougal asks for modification of the bond to allow to work at the Dairy-O only after the public school has closed (6 pm to 10 PM) and  only allowed in the kitchen defendant may not be anywhere else in or out of the Dairy-O or traveling to or from the Dairy-O. State objects to the bond modification. Mother comments. Court denies the bond modification.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant has posted bond. Case was adjourned to 05/03/22 at 9 am in front of  a Court Commissioner Angel.

Attorney McDougal will notify her client of the change.

to Those Posting Cash Bond
Payable # 65657

1:06 PM DA Harper for the State, Defendant by video in RCSD Jail with Attorney McDougal

Recommendation on bail from the State :
$5,000 cash bond 
No contact or working at the Dairy- O.
No contact with any public parks including any softball games.
Not to be on the premises of any school.
No contact with public pools to include the Symons Rec Center.
No contact with any girls under the age of 18 either in person or via computerized communication.

Defense/Defendant comments:
Attorney McDougal asks for a signature bond or a cash bond of $1,000 or less.
Court speaks about no contact or working at the Dairy-O. Attorney McDougal speaks about alternative.

Court Orders:
$5,000 cash bond 
No contact or working at the Dairy- O.
No contact with any public parks including any softball games.
Not to be on the premises of any school.
No contact with public pools to include the Symons Rec Center.
No contact with any girls under the age of 18 either in person or via computerized communication.


Next Appearance set for 04/29/22 at 1 PM
